input_text:
Job Title: Estimating Coordinator

Location: Costa Mesa, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Company Overview

JRM is one of the top General Contracting and Construction Management Firms with over a decade of trusted experience. Headquartered in New York City with offices in New Jersey, California, and Florida, JRM delivers the highest quality services to clients that include Fortune 500 corporations, respected property owners & developers, major law firms, media & tech firms, leading luxury retailers, renowned hospitality groups, life sciences & healthcare organizations, and financial services firms. JRM knows that dedicated, accomplished employees are the heart of any successful enterprise. Weâ€™re always looking to add passionate personnel to our teams across the US.

Job Summary

JRM West is seeking an Estimating Coordinator to join their growing team. The applicant must be a passionate individual who is ready to contribute their talents and expertise to an environment that rewards hard work, cooperation, and respect.

Responsibilities And Duties

 Preparing bid paperwork, bid invitations and spreadsheets, presentation materials, and distributing documents as directed  Distributing drawings in both paper and electronic versions; coordinating with printing company on printing requests as well as on maintaining originals  Coordinating with vendors on proposal submissions  Providing support in the bidding process, including calling and qualifying subcontractors in each trade to bid project; making plan copies; creating correspondence and bid books; performing follow-up tasks; and ensuring that all proposals have been collected  Performing follow up on price submission, maintain department databases, and assist senior estimators with general requests  Meeting with estimators to determine if there is proper coverage in a trade line and addressing bid lists throughout a bid. 

Qualifications

 Prior experience working within the construction industry with an understanding of construction project lifecycles is a plus, but not required  Resourceful, driven, and self-motivated individual  Strong internal and external communication skills  Must be able to efficiently multi-task  Excellent time management and organizational skills  Ability to work well under pressure of deadlines and meet them  Ability to maintain Vendor Relationships 

Computer Systems

 Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook), and Building Connected 

Salary Information

To the extent this position is performed in California, the annual salary for this role is $65,000.

The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with JRM without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law. Eligible candidates must be work authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

Meeting with estimators to determine if there is proper coverage in a trade line and addressing bid lists throughout a bid
